text:
🧵 THREAD: Stop watching "How-To" tutorials. They are ruining your growth.

You feel productive, but you're actually just procrastinating.

User @_newdev0 just exposed the uncomfortable truth. 👇

1/ The "Project 11" Protocol.

Most people quit at Project 3 because their code looks like trash. That is the point.

Projects 1-10 are supposed to suck. They are the sacrifice you make to the coding gods. You don't start learning until you ship the 11th one.

2/ Passive learning is a trap.

❌ The Old Way: Watch 10 hours of video -> Feel smart -> Build nothing.
✅ The New Way: Build garbage -> Break it -> Fix it -> Learn.

You cannot theory-craft your way to seniority.

3/ Why this mindset wins:

Junior devs optimize for "clean code" on their first try (Perfectionism).
Senior devs optimize for shipping, breaking, and refactoring (Iteration).

You can't steer a parked car. Get moving.

4/ Let's see who is actually shipping.

Drop a link to your "Project 11" (or whatever you are working on right now) in the replies.

I'll check out every single one. 👇
